components.name: AsyncHBase Sink
components.description: This sink writes data to HBase using an asynchronous model. A class implementing AsyncHbaseEventSerializer which is specified by the configuration is used to convert the events into HBase puts and/or increments. These puts and increments are then written to HBase. This sink uses the Asynchbase API to write to HBase. This sink provides the same consistency guarantees as HBase, which is currently row-wise atomicity. In the event of Hbase failing to write certain events, the sink will replay all events in that transaction. The type is the FQCN: org.apache.flume.sink.hbase.AsyncHBaseSink.

table.name: Table
table.description: The name of the table in Hbase to write to.

columnFamily.name: Column family
columnFamily.description: The column family in Hbase to write to.

zookeeperQuorum.name: Zookeeper quorum
zookeeperQuorum.description: The quorum spec. This is the value for the property hbase.zookeeper.quorum in hbase-site.xml

znodeParent.name: Znode parent
znodeParent.description: The base path for the znode for the -ROOT- region. Value of zookeeper.znode.parent in hbase-site.xml

batchSize.name: Batch size
batchSize.description: Number of events to be written per txn.

coalesceIncrements.name: Coalesce increments
coalesceIncrements.description: The directory where files will be stored

timeout.name: Timeout
timeout.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) the sink waits for acks from hbase for all events in a transaction.
